<|user|>
Solve the equation: (x - 2)(x + 3) = (x - 7)(x + 7).
<|end|>

<|assistant|>
First, expand both sides of the equation. On the left-hand side, expand (x - 2)(x + 3): Multiply x by (x + 3) to get x² + 3x, and multiply -2 by (x + 3) to get -2x - 6. Combine terms to get x² + x - 6. On the right-hand side, expand (x - 7)(x + 7) using the difference of squares formula: (x - 7)(x + 7) = x² - 49. The equation now becomes: x² + x - 6 = x² - 49. Do you understand this step?
<|end|>

<|user|>
Yes.
<|end|>

<|assistant|>
Great! Subtract x² from both sides to simplify: x - 6 = -49. Add 6 to both sides: x = -43. Do you understand this step?
<|end|>

<|user|>
Yes.
<|end|>

<|end|>
